author: Amrith Ramkumar
title: Gold Falls After Jobs Report
text:
Gold prices fell Friday after the February jobs report showed U.S. employers hired workers at the strongest pace in a year and a half, and the unemployment rate held at a 17-year low in February, but the pace of wage growth eased.
Gold for April delivery was down 0.4% at $1,317.10 a troy ounce on the Comex division of the New York Mercantile Exchange. Prices have traded between $1,305 and $1,360 this year, swinging based on moves in the dollar and investor expectations for higher interest rates.
